definition[0]: a written order to come to a court of law and be a witness
definition[1]: to order someone to come to a court of law and be a witness
example[0]: James was subpoenaed as a witness.
definition[2]: to order someone to come to court and be a witness, or to order someone to give documents to the court
example[1]: Telephone companiesâ€™ records can be subpoenaed.
example[2]: We will subpoena him to give evidence.
definition[3]: a document ordering someone to come to court and be a witness, or ordering someone to give documents to the court
example[3]: The regulators issued a subpoena for documents relating to 23 company audits.
